options.name: -p
tip:
U: -p <profile>
Start the terminal with the specified configuration file
E: -p "PowerShell"   --- Start with PowerShell

options.name: -d
tip:
U: -d <dir>
Specify the startup directory
E: -d "D:\"   --- Start from D drive

options.name: -F
options.tip: Launch window in full screen mode

options.name: --pos
tip:
Specify the location of the terminal in the format "x,y"
(The upper left corner of the screen is the origin: x is 0, y is 0)
E: --pos 100,200   --- Start at x 100, y 200.

options.name: --size
tip: Specify the number of columns and rows for the terminal in the format "column,row"
E: --size 80,25   --- Start with 80 columns and 25 rows

options.name: -w
tip:
Specify the terminal window for running the given command line
E: -w 0   --- Run in the current window
   -w 1   --- Run in the next window

common_options.name: -h
tip: Print this help message and exit

description: You can use it to start a terminal.
